title: Shellshock (software bug)
summary: Shellshock, also known as Bashdoor,[1] is a family of security bugs[2] in the Unix Bash shell, the first of which was disclosed on 24 September 2014. Shellshock could enable an attacker to cause Bash to execute arbitrary commands and gain unauthorized access[3] to many Internet-facing services, such as web servers, that use Bash to process requests.
